required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Daclatasvir (BMS-790052) Plus Standard of Care (Pegylated-interferon Alpha-2b and Ribavirin) in Japanese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a Study of BMS-790052 in Combination With Peginterferon Alfa-2b (PegIntron®) and Ribavirin (Rebetol®) in Japanese Subjects With Genotype 1 Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to identify at least 1 dose of daclatasvir that is safe, well tolerated, and efficacious when combined with peginterferon-alfa and ribavirin for the treatment of hepatitis C virus genotype 1 in chronically infected patients who are treatment-naïve and nonresponsive to the standard of care

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Extended Rapid Virologic Response (eRVR)
primary_outcome.description: eRVR was defined as undetectable hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA (ie, HCV RNA <15 IU/mL, the lower limit of detection, target not detected) at both Weeks 4 and 12. HCV RNA levels were measured by Tobas TaqMan HCV Auto from the central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Rapid Virologic Response (RVR)
secondary_outcome.description: RVR was defined as undetectable hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA (ie, HCV RNA <15 IU/mL, the lower limit of detection, target not detected) at Week 4. HCV RNA levels were measured by CobasTaqMan HCV Auto from the central laboratory .

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Early Virologic Response (cEVR)
secondary_outcome.description: cEVR was defined as undetectable hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA (ie, HCV RNA <15 IU/mL, the lower limit of detection, target not detected) at Week 12 on treatment. HCV RNA levels were measured by Cobas TaqMan HCV Auto from the central laboratory

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
secondary_outcome.description: SVR at follow-up Week 4 (SVR4), follow-up Week 12 (SVR12), and follow-up Week 24 (SVR24) is defined as undetectable hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA (ie, HCV RNA <15 IU/mL, the lower limit of detection, target not detected) at each of these timepoints. HCV RNA levels were measured by Cobas TaqMan HCV Auto from the central laboratory .

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From on-treatment Week 1 to Follow-up Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic failure is defined by the following 6 categories: 1.Virologic breakthrough, defined as confirmed >1 log10 increase in hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA over nadir or confirmed HCV RNA ≥limit of quantitation (LOQ) after confirmed undetectable HCV RNA while on treatment. 2. <1 log10 decrease in HCV RNA from baseline at Week 4 of treatment. 3. Failure to achieve early virologic response, defined as <2 log10 decrease in HCV RNA from baseline at Week 12 of treatment. 4. Detectable HCV RNA at Week 12, and HCV RNA ≥LOQ at Week 24 of treatment. 5. Detectable HCV RNA at end of treatment (including early discontinuation). 6 Relapse, defined as detectable HCV RNA during follow-up after undetectable HCV RNA levels at end of treatment.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Treatment-related AEs, and Death as Outcome
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 30 days after last dose of study drug
other_outcome.description: AE was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that does not has a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalization. Treatment-related AE was defined as an AE that had certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 3 to 4 Abnormalities on Laboratory Test Results
other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 30 days after last dose of study drug
other_outcome.description: Clinically significant marked abnormalities in laboratory test results graded by the Division of AIDS grading table, 2004. Hemoglobin: Grade 3= <7.0 to 8.9 g/dL, Grade 4= <7.0 g/dL. Lymphocytes: Grade 3= 350-499 cells/mm^3, Grade 4= <350 cells/mm^3. Neutrophils: Grade 3= 500-999 cells/mm^3, Grade 4= <500 cells/mm^3. White blood cells (WBC): Grade 3= 1000-1499 cells/mm^3, Grade 4= <1000 cells/mm^3. Alanine aminotransferase (ALT): Grade 3= 5.1-10*upper limit of normal (ULN), Grade 4= >10.0*ULN. Aspartate aminotransferase (AST): Grade 3= 5.1-10*ULN, Grade 4= >10.0*ULN. Total bilirubin: Grade 3= 2.6-5*ULN, Grade 4= >5.0*ULN.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients chronically infected with hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 1
- HCV RNA viral load ≥10*5* IU/mL at screening
- Naïve or nonresponsive to the current standard of care
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Cirrhosis
- Hepatocellular carcinoma
- Coinfection with hepatitis B virus, HIV-1 or HIV-2

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 6 sites in Japan.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 51 participants were enrolled, of which 45 were randomized to receive treatment and 6 were discontinued for no longer meeting study criteria.

group.title: Placebo + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Treatment-naive)
group.description: Participants received a matching placebo of daclatasvir tablet, once daily coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and peginterferon alpha (pegIFNα) injection, once weekly. Treatment-naive participants were those who had never been exposed to any hepatitis C virus (HCV) therapy with interferon IFNα-containing regimens, including pegIFNα/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 10­ mg + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Treatment-naive)
group.description: Participants received 10 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and peginterferon alpha-2b (pegIFNα) injection, once weekly. Treatment-naive participants were those who had never been exposed to any hepatitis C virus (HCV) therapy with interferon IFNα-containing regimens, including pegIFNα/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 60­ mg + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Treatment-naive)
group.description: Participants received 60 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and pegIFNα injection, once weekly. Treatment-naive participants were those who had never been exposed to any HCV therapy with interferon IFNα-containing regimens, including pegIFNα/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 10­ mg + pegIFNα+ Ribavirin (Nonresponders)
group.description: Participants received 10 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and pegIFNα injection once weekly. Nonresponders were participants who had never attained undetectable HCV RNA levels, after at least 12 weeks of the current standard of care, pegIFNα/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 60­ mg + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Nonresponders)
group.description: Participants received 60 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and pegIFNα injection once weekly. Nonresponders were participants who had never attained undetectable HCV RNA levels, after at least 12 weeks of the current standard of care pegIFNα/ribavirin.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Treatment-related AEs, and Death as Outcome
outcome.description: AE was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that does not has a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalization. Treatment-related AE was defined as an AE that had certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 30 days after last dose of study drug
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Treatment-related AEs, and Death as Outcome
measure.description: AE was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that does not has a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalization. Treatment-related AE was defined as an AE that had certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug.
measure.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Grade 3 to 4 Abnormalities on Laboratory Test Results
outcome.description: Clinically significant marked abnormalities in laboratory test results graded by the Division of AIDS grading table, 2004. Hemoglobin: Grade 3= <7.0 to 8.9 g/dL, Grade 4= <7.0 g/dL. Lymphocytes: Grade 3= 350-499 cells/mm^3, Grade 4= <350 cells/mm^3. Neutrophils: Grade 3= 500-999 cells/mm^3, Grade 4= <500 cells/mm^3. White blood cells (WBC): Grade 3= 1000-1499 cells/mm^3, Grade 4= <1000 cells/mm^3. Alanine aminotransferase (ALT): Grade 3= 5.1-10*upper limit of normal (ULN), Grade 4= >10.0*ULN. Aspartate aminotransferase (AST): Grade 3= 5.1-10*ULN, Grade 4= >10.0*ULN. Total bilirubin: Grade 3= 2.6-5*ULN, Grade 4= >5.0*ULN.

Nonresponders were participants who had never attained undetectable HCV RNA levels, after at least 12 weeks of the current standard of care, pegIFNα/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 60 mg + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Nonresponders)
group.description: Participants received 60 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and pegIFNα injection once weekly. Nonresponders were participants who had never attained undetectable HCV RNA levels, after at least 12 weeks of the current standard of care, pegIFNα/ribavirin

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) at Weeks 4, 12, and 24
measure.description: SVR at follow-up Week 4 (SVR4), follow-up Week 12 (SVR12), and follow-up Week 24 (SVR24) is defined as undetectable hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA (ie, HCV RNA <15 IU/mL, the lower limit of detection, target not detected) at each of these timepoints. HCV RNA levels were measured by Cobas TaqMan HCV Auto from the central laboratory .
measure.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Failure
outcome.description: Virologic failure is defined by the following 6 categories: 1.Virologic breakthrough, defined as confirmed >1 log10 increase in hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA over nadir or confirmed HCV RNA ≥limit of quantitation (LOQ) after confirmed undetectable HCV RNA while on treatment. 2. <1 log10 decrease in HCV RNA from baseline at Week 4 of treatment. 3. Failure to achieve early virologic response, defined as <2 log10 decrease in HCV RNA from baseline at Week 12 of treatment. 4. Detectable HCV RNA at Week 12, and HCV RNA ≥LOQ at Week 24 of treatment. 5. Detectable HCV RNA at end of treatment (including early discontinuation). 6 Relapse, defined as detectable HCV RNA during follow-up after undetectable HCV RNA levels at end of treatment.
outcome.time_frame: From on-treatment Week 1 to Follow-up Week 24
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy.

group.title: Placebo + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Treatment-naive)
group.description: Participants received a matching placebo of daclatasvir tablet, once daily coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and peginterferon alpha(pegIFNα) injection, once weekly. Treatment-naive participants were those who had never been exposed to any hepatitis C virus (HCV) therapy with interferon IFNα-containing regimens, including pegIFNα/ribavirin

group.title: Daclatasvir 10 mg + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Treatment-naive)
group.description: Participants received 10 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and pegIFNα injection, once weekly. Treatment-naive participants were those who had never been exposed to any HCV therapy with interferon IFNα-containing regimens, including pegIFNα/ribavirin

group.title: Daclatasvir 60 mg + Peg-IFNα + Ribavirin (Treatment-naive)
group.description: received 60 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and pegIFNα injection, once weekly. Treatment-naive participants were those who had never been exposed to any HCV therapy with interferon IFNα-containing regimens, including pegIFNα/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 10 mg + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Nonresponders)
group.description: Participants received 10 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and pegIFNα injection once weekly. Nonresponders were participants who had never attained undetectable HCV RNA levels, after at least 12 weeks of the current standard of care, pegIFNα/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 60 mg + pegIFNα + Ribavirin (Nonresponders)
group.description: Participants received 60 mg of daclatasvir, once daily, coadministered with ribavirin, twice daily, and pegIFNα injection once weekly. Nonresponders were participants who had never attained undetectable HCV RNA levels, after at least 12 weeks of the current standard of care pegIFNα/ribavirin.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Failure
measure.description: Virologic failure is defined by the following 6 categories: 1.Virologic breakthrough, defined as confirmed >1 log10 increase in hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA over nadir or confirmed HCV RNA ≥limit of quantitation (LOQ) after confirmed undetectable HCV RNA while on treatment. 2. <1 log10 decrease in HCV RNA from baseline at Week 4 of treatment. 3. Failure to achieve early virologic response, defined as <2 log10 decrease in HCV RNA from baseline at Week 12 of treatment. 4. Detectable HCV RNA at Week 12, and HCV RNA ≥LOQ at Week 24 of treatment. 5. Detectable HCV RNA at end of treatment (including early discontinuation). 6 Relapse, defined as detectable HCV RNA during follow-up after undetectable HCV RNA levels at end of treatment.
measure.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy.

reported_events.time_frame: From baseline up to 30 days after last dose of study drug

group.title: Placebo+pegIFNα +Ribavirin (Treatment Naive)
group.description: Participants received a matching placebo of daclatasvir tablet, orally, once daily (OD) with peginterferon alpha-2a (pegIFNα) subcutaneously once weekly and ribavirin orally, twice daily (BID). Treatment naive participants were those who had never been exposed to any Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) therapy with interferon IFNα containing regimens including pegIFNα-2b/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 10­ mg+pegIFNα+Ribavirin (Treatment Naive)
group.description: Participants received 10 mg of daclatasvir OD coadministered with pegIFNα subcutaneously once weekly and ribavirin orally BID. Treatment naive participants were defined as those who had never been exposed to any HCV therapy with IFNα containing regimens including pegIFNα-2b/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 60­ mg+pegIFNα+Ribavirin (Treatment Naive)
group.description: Participants received 60 mg of daclatasvir OD in coadministration with pegIFNα administered subcutaneously once weekly and ribavirin administered orally BID. Treatment naive participants were defined as those who had never been exposed to any HCV therapy with IFNα containing regimens including pegIFNα-2b/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 10­ mg+pegIFNα+Ribavirin (Non-­Responders)
group.description: Participants received 10 mg of daclatasvir OD coadministered with pegIFNα subcutaneously once weekly and ribavirin orally BID. Non-responders were participants who had never attained undetectable HCV RNA levels, after at least 12 weeks of the current standard of care pegIFNα-2b/ribavirin.

group.title: Daclatasvir 60­ mg+pegIFNα+Ribavirin (Non-­Responders)
group.description: Participants received 60 mg of daclatasvir OD in coadministration with pegIFNα administered subcutaneously once weekly and ribavirin administered orally BID. Non-responders were participants who had never attained undetectable HCV RNA levels, after at least 12 weeks of the current standard of care pegIFNα-2b/ribavirin.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
